chart_metadata.name: wg-easy
chart_metadata.description: WG-Easy is the easiest way to install & manage WireGuard!

runAsContext.description: WG Easy runs as root user.

capabilities.name: NET_RAW
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to use raw sockets.

capabilities.name: SYS_MODULE
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to load kernel modules.

capabilities.name: NET_ADMIN
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to perform various network-related operations.

groups.name: Advanced Pod Configuration
groups.description: Configure Advanced Pod Options for WG-Easy

attrs.label: UDP Port
attrs.description: The port for the WG-Easy Wireguard service.

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description: The port for the WG-Easy Web UI.

attrs.label: Hostname or IP
attrs.description: The public hostname or IP of your VPN server.

attrs.label: Port for Client Configuration
attrs.description:
The port accessible from the clients.</br>
This is ONLY used on the client configuration generation in the "Endpoint" field.

attrs.label: Password for WebUI
attrs.description: When set, requires a password when logging in to the Web UI.

attrs.label: Persistent Keep Alive
attrs.description: Value in seconds to keep the "connection" open. If this value is 0, then connections won't be kept alive.

attrs.label: Device Name
attrs.description: Ethernet device the wireguard traffic should be forwarded through.

attrs.label: Clients MTU
attrs.description: The MTU the clients will use.

attrs.label: Clients IP Address Range
attrs.description: Clients IP address range.

attrs.label: Clients DNS Server
attrs.description: Clients DNS Server.

attrs.label: Allowed IPs
attrs.description: Allowed IPs clients will use. If none provided, <0.0.0.0/0,::/0> will be used.

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for WG-Easy.

attrs.label: WG-Easy Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store WG-Easy Configuration.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Host Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Force Flag
attrs.description: Enabling `Force` applies ACL even if the path has existing data

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for WG-Easy.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB Share (Mounts a persistent volume claim to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Host Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Force Flag
attrs.description: Enabling `Force` applies ACL even if the path has existing data

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: SMB Share Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the SMB Share.

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: The server for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Share
attrs.description: The share name for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Domain (Optional)
attrs.description: The domain for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: The username for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for WG-Easy.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for WG-Easy.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

2.0.18.app_readme:
WG-Easy

WG-Easy (WireGuard Easy) is the easiest way to install & manage WireGuard!
2.0.18.detailed_readme:
WG-Easy

WG-Easy (WireGuard Easy) is the easiest way to install & manage WireGuard!

chart_metadata.name: wg-easy
chart_metadata.description: WG-Easy is the easiest way to install & manage WireGuard!

runAsContext.description: WG Easy runs as root user.

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SYS_CHROOT
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to use chroot.

capabilities.name: MKNOD
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to create device nodes.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: FSETID
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to set file capabilities.

capabilities.name: KILL
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to kill processes.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETPCAP
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to set process capabilities.

capabilities.name: NET_BIND_SERVICE
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to bind to privileged ports.

capabilities.name: SETFCAP
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to set file capabilities.

capabilities.name: NET_RAW
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to use raw sockets.

capabilities.name: AUDIT_WRITE
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to write to audit log.

capabilities.name: SYS_MODULE
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to load kernel modules.

capabilities.name: NET_ADMIN
capabilities.description: WG Easy is able to perform various network-related operations.

questions.label: CPU Limit resource limits
questions.description: CPU resource limit allow  plain integer values with suffix m(milli) e.g 1000m, 100.

questions.label: Memory Limit
questions.description: Memory limits is specified by number of bytes. Followed by quantity suffix like E,P,T,G,M,k and Ei,Pi,Ti,Mi,Gi,Ki can also be used. e.g 129e6, 129M, 128974848000m, 123Mi
